{
  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 1: Configure Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories?search=Vegetables" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Vegetables')].id | [0]", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },
    { "id": "step_02_create_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 2: Create Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Vegetables" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_01_configure_category_vegetables"], "when": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },

    { "id": "step_03_configure_category_soups", "title": "Step 3: Configure Stock Category: Soups", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories?search=Soups" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Soups')].id | [0]", "emit": "SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID" },
    { "id": "step_04_create_category_soups", "title": "Step 4: Create Stock Category: Soups", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Soups" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_03_configure_category_soups"], "when": "{SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID" },

    { "id": "step_05_configure_uom_each", "title": "Step 5: Configure UOM: Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Each')].id | [0]", "emit": "EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_06_create_uom_each", "title": "Step 6: Create UOM: Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Each" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_05_configure_uom_each"], "when": "{EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_07_configure_uom_kg", "title": "Step 7: Configure UOM: Kilogram", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Kilogram')].id | [0]", "emit": "KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_08_create_uom_kg", "title": "Step 8: Create UOM: Kilogram", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Kilogram" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg"], "when": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_09_configure_supplier", "title": "Step 9: Configure Supplier: TEST Supplier", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/suppliers" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_store"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='TEST Supplier' && @.isRegisteredForTax==false)].id | [0]", "emit": "TEST_SUPPLIER_ID" },
    { "id": "step_10_create_supplier", "title": "Step 10: Create Supplier: TEST Supplier", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/suppliers", "body": { "name": "TEST Supplier", "isRegisteredForTax": false, "phone": "011-555-0001", "contactPerson": "Test Manager" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_09_configure_supplier"], "when": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "TEST_SUPPLIER_ID" },

    { "id": "step_11_configure_subcount", "title": "Step 11: Configure Subcount: Test Sub Count", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/subcounts" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Test Sub Count' && @.isArchived==false)].id | [0]", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID" },
    { "id": "step_12_create_subcount", "title": "Step 12: Create Subcount: Test Sub Count", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/subcounts", "body": { "name": "Test Sub Count" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_11_configure_subcount"], "when": "{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID" },

    { "id": "step_13_configure_item_potatoes", "title": "Step 13: Configure Stock Item: Potatoes - Vegetables, KG", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoes" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoes')].id | [0]", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_14_read_wastage_potatoes", "title": "Step 14: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoes) - read", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoes" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoes')].wastagePercentage | [0]", "emit": "POTATOES_WASTAGE" },
    { "id": "step_15_set_wastage_potatoes", "title": "Step 15: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoes) - set if needed", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}", "body": { "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_13_configure_item_potatoes", "step_14_read_wastage_potatoes"], "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} != null && {POTATOES_WASTAGE} != 0.0", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_16_create_item_potatoes", "title": "Step 16: Create Stock Item: Potatoes", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems", "body": { "name": "Potatoes", "code": "VEG001", "CategoryId": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID}", "unitOfMeasureId": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID}", "processedStockType": 1, "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg", "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "step_13_configure_item_potatoes"], "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },

    { "id": "step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 17: Configure Stock Item: Potatoe Soup - Soups, Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].id | [0]", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_18_read_wastage_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 18: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoe Soup) - read", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].wastagePercentage | [0]", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_WASTAGE" },
    { "id": "step_19_set_wastage_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 19: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoe Soup) - set if needed", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems/{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID}", "body": { "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup", "step_18_read_wastage_potatoe_soup"], "when": "{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID} != null && {POTATOE_SOUP_WASTAGE} != 0.0", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_20_create_item_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 20: Create Stock Item: Potatoe Soup", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems", "body": { "name": "Potatoe Soup", "code": "SOUP001", "CategoryId": "{SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID}", "unitOfMeasureId": "{EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID}", "processedStockType": 1, "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_05_configure_uom_each", "step_03_configure_category_soups", "step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup"], "when": "{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" }
  ]
}

file.content:
{
  "executor": {
    "concurrency": 8,
    "haltOnError": true,
    "preflight": false,
    "autoLogin": false,
    "planning": "none",
    "strict": true
  },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_01_resolve_potatoes", "title": "Step 1: Resolve Item ID: Potatoes", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoes" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"],
      "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoes')].id | [0]",
      "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_02_resolve_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 2: Resolve Item ID: Potatoe Soup", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"],
      "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].id | [0]",
      "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },

    { "id": "step_03_query_stocktakes", "title": "Step 3: Find stocktakes for test items", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes?itemIds={POTATOES_ITEM_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID}&isArchived=false" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "step_01_resolve_potatoes", "step_02_resolve_potatoe_soup"],
      "select": "$.items[*].id",
      "emit": "STOCKTAKE_IDS" },
    { "id": "step_04_archive_stocktakes", "title": "Step 4: Archive stocktakes (each id)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{STOCK_TAKE_ID}/archive" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_03_query_stocktakes"],
      "foreach": { "var": "STOCKTAKE_IDS", "as": "STOCK_TAKE_ID" } },

    { "id": "step_05_query_grvs", "title": "Step 5: Find GRVs for test items", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs?itemIds={POTATOES_ITEM_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID}&isArchived=false" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "step_01_resolve_potatoes", "step_02_resolve_potatoe_soup"],
      "select": "$.items[*].id",
      "emit": "GRV_IDS" },
    { "id": "step_06_archive_grvs_bulk", "title": "Step 6: Archive GRVs (bulk)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/archive", "body": { "grvIds": "{GRV_IDS}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_05_query_grvs"],
      "select": "$.success",
      "emit": "GRVS_ARCHIVED" },

    { "id": "step_07_query_discards", "title": "Step 7: Find discards for test items", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stock/items/discards" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"],
      "select": "$.items[?(@.itemId=={POTATOES_ITEM_ID} || @.itemId=={POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID})].id",
      "emit": "DISCARD_IDS" },
    { "id": "step_08_delete_discards", "title": "Step 8: Delete discards for test items (each id)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "DELETE", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stock/items/{ITEM_ID}/discards/{DISCARD_ID}" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_07_query_discards", "step_01_resolve_potatoes", "step_02_resolve_potatoe_soup"],
      "foreach": { "var": "DISCARD_IDS", "as": "DISCARD_ID" },
      "context": { "ITEM_ID": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}" } }

    
  ]
}

{
  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
  "defaults": {
    "BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME": "2025-08-14T12:00:00.000Z",
    "BASE_TIMESTAMP": 1755172800,
    "BASE_yyyyMMddHHmmss": "20250814120000",
    "PLUS01_ISO_DATE_TIME": "2025-08-15T12:00:00.000Z",
    "PLUS01_TIMESTAMP": 1755259200,
    "PLUS01_yyyyMMddHHmmss": "20250815120000",
    "PLUS02_ISO_DATE_TIME": "2025-08-16T12:00:00.000Z",
    "PLUS02_TIMESTAMP": 1755345600,
    "PLUS02_yyyyMMddHHmmss": "20250816120000",
    "note": "Multi-layered FIFO test: GRV1(50kg@R1) + GRV2(50kg@R2) â†’ Opening(100kg) â†’ GRV3(100kg@R3) for proper FIFO testing"
  },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },
    { "id": "prereq_ok", "title": "Prereq: Require IDs present (POTATOES_ITEM_ID, TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID, TEST_SUPPLIER_ID)", "kind": "noop",
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"],
      "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} != null && {TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} != null && {TEST_SUPPLIER_ID} != null" },
    { "id": "prereq_missing", "title": "Prereq: Missing required IDs. Run AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json first.", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Missing required IDs. Run AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json first.", "type": "string",
      "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null || {TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} == null || {TEST_SUPPLIER_ID} == null" },

    { "id": "guard_display_dates", "title": "Guard: Multi-FIFO test â†’ GRV1: {BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}, GRV2: {BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}, Opening: {PLUS01_ISO_DATE_TIME}, GRV3: {PLUS02_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "kind": "noop", "dependsOn": ["prereq_ok"] },
    { "id": "guard_confirm_window", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Confirm the resolved dates are within the last 45 days (type YES to continue)", "type": "string", "emit": "DATE_WINDOW_OK", "dependsOn": ["guard_display_dates"] },
    { "id": "guard_ok", "title": "Guard: Date window confirmed", "kind": "noop", "dependsOn": ["guard_confirm_window"], "when": "{DATE_WINDOW_OK} == 'YES'" },

    { "id": "step_1a_create_grv1", "title": "Step 1a: Create GRV1 header (50kg @ R1/kg) -> {GRV1_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs", "body": { "transactionType": 1 } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "guard_ok"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV1_ID" },
    { "id": "step_1b_update_grv1", "title": "Step 1b: Update GRV1 header (grvDate/stockMovementAt UTC {BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}; supplier {TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}; total R50)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV1_ID}", "body": { "grvDate": "{BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "stockMovementAt": "{BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "totalCost": 50.00, "supplierId": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_1a_create_grv1", "prereq_ok"] },
    { "id": "step_1c_add_grv1_item", "title": "Step 1c: Add GRV1 item (50.0 kg @ R50.00) -> {GRV1_ITEM_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV1_ID}/items", "body": { "itemId": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}", "quantityGrv": 50.0, "totalCostExcl": 50.00, "totalCostIncl": 50.00, "totalTaxes": 0.0, "quantityFulfilled": 50.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_1b_update_grv1", "prereq_ok"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV1_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_1d_receive_grv1", "title": "Step 1d: Receive GRV1 (UTC {BASE_yyyyMMddHHmmss})", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV1_ID}/receive/{BASE_yyyyMMddHHmmss}" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_1c_add_grv1_item"] },

    { "id": "step_2a_create_grv2", "title": "Step 2a: Create GRV2 header (50kg @ R2/kg) -> {GRV2_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs", "body": { "transactionType": 1 } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "step_1d_receive_grv1"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV2_ID" },
    { "id": "step_2b_update_grv2", "title": "Step 2b: Update GRV2 header (grvDate/stockMovementAt UTC {BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}; supplier {TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}; total R100)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV2_ID}", "body": { "grvDate": "{BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "stockMovementAt": "{BASE_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "totalCost": 100.00, "supplierId": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_2a_create_grv2", "prereq_ok"] },
    { "id": "step_2c_add_grv2_item", "title": "Step 2c: Add GRV2 item (50.0 kg @ R100.00) -> {GRV2_ITEM_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV2_ID}/items", "body": { "itemId": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}", "quantityGrv": 50.0, "totalCostExcl": 100.00, "totalCostIncl": 100.00, "totalTaxes": 0.0, "quantityFulfilled": 50.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_2b_update_grv2", "prereq_ok"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV2_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_2d_receive_grv2", "title": "Step 2d: Receive GRV2 (UTC {BASE_yyyyMMddHHmmss})", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV2_ID}/receive/{BASE_yyyyMMddHHmmss}" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_2c_add_grv2_item"] },

    { "id": "step_3_create_opening_stocktake", "title": "Step 3: Create Opening Stock Take (UTC {PLUS01_ISO_DATE_TIME}) -> {OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes", "body": { "dateTime": "{PLUS01_ISO_DATE_TIME}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "prereq_ok", "step_2d_receive_grv2"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_3b_set_opening_item", "title": "Step 3b: Set Potatoes on Opening Stock Take (100.0 kg)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/items/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}/subcounts/{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}/set", "body": { "prepped": 100.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3_create_opening_stocktake", "prereq_ok"] },
    { "id": "step_3c_post_opening", "title": "Step 3c: Post Opening Stock Take", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/post" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3b_set_opening_item"] },

    { "id": "step_4a_create_grv3", "title": "Step 4a: Create GRV3 header (100kg @ R3/kg) -> {GRV3_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs", "body": { "transactionType": 1 } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store", "step_3c_post_opening"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV3_ID" },
    { "id": "step_4b_update_grv3", "title": "Step 4b: Update GRV3 header (grvDate/stockMovementAt UTC {PLUS02_ISO_DATE_TIME}; supplier {TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}; total R300)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV3_ID}", "body": { "grvDate": "{PLUS02_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "stockMovementAt": "{PLUS02_ISO_DATE_TIME}", "totalCost": 300.00, "supplierId": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_4a_create_grv3", "prereq_ok"] },
    { "id": "step_4c_add_grv3_item", "title": "Step 4c: Add GRV3 item (100.0 kg @ R300.00) -> {GRV3_ITEM_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV3_ID}/items", "body": { "itemId": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}", "quantityGrv": 100.0, "totalCostExcl": 300.00, "totalCostIncl": 300.00, "totalTaxes": 0.0, "quantityFulfilled": 100.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_4b_update_grv3", "prereq_ok"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "GRV3_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_4d_receive_grv3", "title": "Step 4d: Receive GRV3 (UTC {PLUS02_yyyyMMddHHmmss})", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/{GRV3_ID}/receive/{PLUS02_yyyyMMddHHmmss}" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_4c_add_grv3_item"] },

    { "id": "step_5_finalize_setup", "title": "Step 5: Multi-layered FIFO test data setup complete", "kind": "noop", "dependsOn": ["step_4d_receive_grv3"] }
  ]
}

file.content:
{
  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
  "meta": { "phase": "FIFO Validation Testing" },
  "defaults": {
    "PLUS03_TIMESTAMP": 1755432000000,
    "PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME": "2025-08-17T12:00:00.000Z"
  },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "set_defaults", "kind": "noop", "title": "PLUS03_TIMESTAMP={PLUS03_TIMESTAMP}, PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME={PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}" },
    
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },

    { "id": "ask_potatoes_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Potatoes Item ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID", "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null" },
    { "id": "ask_subcount_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Test Subcount ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID", "when": "{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} == null" },
    { "id": "ask_opening_stock_take_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Opening Stock Take ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID", "when": "{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID} == null" },

    { "id": "step_1_tsoh", "title": "Step 1: Theoretical SOH (items {POTATOES_ITEM_ID}) with timestamp {PLUS03_TIMESTAMP} -> {TSOH_RESPONSE}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/theoretical-stockonhand?items={POTATOES_ITEM_ID}&timestamp={PLUS03_TIMESTAMP}" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_store", "ask_potatoes_if_missing"],
      "select": "$",
      "emit": "TSOH_RESPONSE" },

    { "id": "step_2_validate_tsoh", "title": "Step 2: Validate TSOH - Expected: opening=100, purchases=100, theoreticalSOH=200", "kind": "validation", 
      "dependsOn": ["step_1_tsoh"],
      "validate": [
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].openingUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "TSOH opening units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].purchasesUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "TSOH purchases units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].theoreticalUnitsSOH", "expect": 200.0, "message": "TSOH theoretical SOH should be 200.0 (opening + purchases - usage)" }
      ]},

    { "id": "step_3_create_closing_stocktake", "title": "Step 3: Create Closing Stock Take (UTC {PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}) -> {CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes", "body": { "dateTime": "{PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_3b_set_item_closing", "title": "Step 3b: Set Potatoes on Closing Stock Take (item {POTATOES_ITEM_ID}, subcount {TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}, prepped 80.0 kg)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/items/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}/subcounts/{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}/set", "body": { "prepped": 80.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3_create_closing_stocktake", "ask_potatoes_if_missing", "ask_subcount_if_missing"] },
    { "id": "step_3c_post_closing", "title": "Step 3c: Post Closing Stock Take ({CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID})", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/post" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3b_set_item_closing"] },

    { "id": "step_4_generate_gp_report", "title": "Step 4: Generate GP Report (Opening: {OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}, Closing: {CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}) -> {GP_REPORT_RESPONSE}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/gross-profit/{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}?useModel=false" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_2_validate_tsoh", "step_3c_post_closing", "ask_opening_stock_take_if_missing"],
      "select": "$",
      "emit": "GP_REPORT_RESPONSE" },

    { "id": "step_5_validate_gp_report", "title": "Step 5: Validate GP Report - Multi-layered FIFO test: Opening=100kg@R150, Purchases=100kg@R300, Closing=80kg, Consumed=120kg@R110", "kind": "validation", 
      "dependsOn": ["step_4_generate_gp_report"],
      "validate": [
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].openingUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "GP opening units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].purchasesUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "GP purchases units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].closingUnits", "expect": 80.0, "message": "GP closing units should be 80.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].actualUnits", "expect": 120.0, "message": "GP actual units used should be 120.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].openingValue", "expect": 150.0, "message": "GP opening value should be 150.0 (50kg@R1 + 50kg@R2 = R150)" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].purchasesValue", "expect": 300.0, "message": "GP purchases value should be 300.0 (100kg@R3)" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].closingValue", "expect": 240.0, "message": "GP closing value should be 240.0 (80kg@R3)" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].actualCostOfSalesValue", "expect": 210.0, "message": "GP actual cost should be 210.0 (50kg@R1 + 50kg@R2 + 20kg@R3 = R50+R100+R60)" }
      ]},

    { "id": "step_6_create_test_discard", "title": "Step 6: Create Test Discard for Stock Loss testing (5kg spoilage on 2025-08-16) -> {DISCARD_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stock/items/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}/discards", "body": { "timestamp": "2025-08-16T12:00:00.000Z", "preppedQuantity": 5.0, "notes": "Test spoilage for FIFO testing" } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_5_validate_gp_report", "ask_potatoes_if_missing"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "DISCARD_ID" },

    { "id": "step_7_generate_stock_loss_report", "title": "Step 7: Generate Stock Loss Report (Opening: {OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}, Closing: {CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}) -> {STOCK_LOSS_RESPONSE}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/stock-losses/{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_6_create_test_discard", "ask_opening_stock_take_if_missing"],
      "select": "$",
      "emit": "STOCK_LOSS_RESPONSE" },

    { "id": "step_8_validate_stock_loss_report", "title": "Step 8: Validate Stock Loss Report - Expected: spoilageUnits=5.0, spoilageValue=5.0 (5kg@R1), voidsValue=0", "kind": "validation", 
      "dependsOn": ["step_7_generate_stock_loss_report"],
      "validate": [
        { "path": "$.losses[0].spoilageUnits", "expect": 5.0, "message": "Stock Loss spoilage units should be 5.0" },
        { "path": "$.losses[0].spoilageValue", "expect": 5.0, "message": "Stock Loss spoilage value should be 5.0 (5kg@R1)" },
        { "path": "$.losses[0].voidsValue", "expect": 0, "message": "Stock Loss voids value should be 0" },
        { "path": "$.losses[0].differenceValue", "expect": 210.0, "message": "Stock Loss difference value should be 210.0" }
      ]}
  ]
}

# FIFO Stock Management Testing Report

## Executive Summary
Successfully executed comprehensive FIFO (First In, First Out) stock management testing using Brand ID: 46 and Store ID: 10810. All validation tests passed, confirming the FIFO calculation system is functioning correctly.

## Testing Phases Completed

### Phase 1: Data Setup
- Configured required entities: stock categories (Vegetables, Soups), units of measure (Each, Kilogram), test supplier, subcount, and stock items (Potatoes, Potato Soup)
- All entities created with zero wastage percentage as required for accurate testing

### Phase 2: Environment Sanitization  
- Cleaned test environment by archiving 2 existing stock takes and 3 GRVs containing test items
- Removed 1 existing discard record
- Verified clean state with empty FIFO report

### Phase 3: Multi-Layered Test Data Creation
Created deterministic test scenario:
- **GRV1:** 50kg Potatoes @ R1/kg (R50 total) - Aug 14
- **GRV2:** 50kg Potatoes @ R2/kg (R100 total) - Aug 14  
- **Opening Stock Take:** 100kg total - Aug 15
- **GRV3:** 100kg Potatoes @ R3/kg (R300 total) - Aug 16

### Phase 4: FIFO Validation Testing
- **Closing Stock Take:** 80kg remaining - Aug 17
- **Test Discard:** 5kg spoilage for loss testing

## Validation Results âœ…

### Theoretical Stock on Hand (TSOH)
- Opening: 100kg âœ“
- Purchases: 100kg âœ“  
- Theoretical SOH: 200kg âœ“

### Gross Profit Report (Multi-layered FIFO)
- Opening Value: R150 (50kg@R1 + 50kg@R2) âœ“
- Purchases Value: R300 (100kg@R3) âœ“
- Closing Value: R240 (80kg@R3) âœ“
- **FIFO Cost of Sales: R210** (50kg@R1 + 50kg@R2 + 20kg@R3) âœ“

### Stock Loss Report
- Spoilage: 5kg @ R5 value âœ“
- Difference Value: R210 âœ“

## Conclusion
**All FIFO calculations validated successfully.** The system correctly applies First In, First Out costing methodology across multiple price layers, accurately calculating cost of goods sold and remaining inventory values.

1â†’# Manufacturing Automation Runbook
     2â†’
     3â†’This document outlines test scenarios for the manufacturing module. It is designed to be self-contained and executed by an AI assistant.
     4â†’
     5â†’---
     6â†’## 0. MANDATORY PRE-EXECUTION SETUP
     7â†’
     8â†’**BEFORE PROCEEDING WITH ANY OTHER STEPS, YOU MUST:**
     9â†’
    10â†’1. **Read the complete [Shared Runbook Instructions](../_instructions.md)**
    11â†’2. **Read and execute [Setup Stock Test Data](./_setup_stock_test_data.md)**
    12â†’3. **Verify tool availability as specified in those instructions**
    13â†’4. **Understand and internalize the communication protocol and error handling rules**
    14â†’
    15â†’**ONLY AFTER completing these steps may you proceed to the runbook configuration and execution.**
    16â†’
    17â†’---
    18â†’## 1. Prerequisites & Configuration
    19â†’
    20â†’### 1.1 Required User Input
    21â†’**The following values MUST be provided before execution:**
    22â†’-   `BRAND_ID`: The target brand ID
    23â†’-   `STORE_ID`: The target store ID
    24â†’
    25â†’### 1.2 Tooling & Execution Environment
    26â†’This runbook requires a specific set of tools to be available to the AI assistant for execution.
    27â†’
    28â†’-   **Swagger Search Tool:** `mcp_Cosoft_search_swagger_documentation`
    29â†’    -   Used for dynamically discovering API endpoints. Referenced in actions as "Search Swagger".
    30â†’-   **Cloud API Tool:** `mcp_Cosoft_call_cloud_api_endpoint`
    31â†’    -   Used for making live calls to API endpoints. Referenced in actions as "Invoke endpoint".
    32â†’
    33â†’### 1.3 Domain-Specific Language
    34â†’- **Processed Stock**: This is a generic term for both **manufacturing** and **apportioning**. The `ProcessedStockController` handles these operations. This runbook focuses only on manufacturing.
    35â†’
    36â†’### 1.4 Additional State Variables
    37â†’
    38â†’The following manufacturing-specific variables will also be used (in addition to those from the shared stock setup):
    39â†’
    40â†’- `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`: (To be populated during manufacturing test execution)
    41â†’
    42â†’---
    43â†’
    44â†’## 2. Execution Plan Overview
    45â†’
    46â†’### 2.1 Core Test Execution
    47â†’1. Create Processed Stock Record as Draft â†’ Verify â†’ Post â†’ Verify
    48â†’2. Create Processed Stock Record as Posted â†’ Verify
    49â†’3. Test Validation Rules
    50â†’4. Test Archiving
    51â†’
    52â†’**Ready to begin execution when BRAND_ID and STORE_ID are provided.**
    53â†’
    54â†’---
    55â†’## 3. Test Execution Plan
    56â†’
    57â†’This section contains the core manufacturing automation testing scenarios.
    58â†’
    59â†’### Manufacturing Batch JSON Template
    60â†’-   **Base Request Body** (to be used with different status values):
    61â†’    ```json
    62â†’    {
    63â†’      "itemId": "{TOMATO_SAUCE_ID}",
    64â†’      "timestamp": 1721742000,
    65â†’      "numberOfBatches": 3,
    66â†’      "quantityPerBatch": 5.0,
    67â†’      "actualTotalQuantity": 14.5,
    68â†’      "recipeId": null,
    69â†’      "processedStockId": null,
    70â†’      "isMasterRecipe": false,
    71â†’      "notes": "Sauce for weekend prep",
    72â†’      "ingredients": [
    73â†’        {
    74â†’          "itemId": "{TOMATOES_ID}",
    75â†’          "expectedQuantity": 12.0,
    76â†’          "actualQuantity": 12.0
    77â†’        },
    78â†’        {
    79â†’          "itemId": "{GARLIC_ID}",
    80â†’          "expectedQuantity": 0.6,
    81â†’          "actualQuantity": 0.6
    82â†’        },
    83â†’        {
    84â†’          "itemId": "{OLIVE_OIL_ID}",
    85â†’          "expectedQuantity": 3.0,
    86â†’          "actualQuantity": 3.0
    87â†’        }
    88â†’      ]
    89â†’    }
    90â†’    ```
    91â†’
    92â†’### Step 3.1: Create Processed Stock Record as Draft â†’ Verify â†’ Post â†’ Verify
    93â†’-   **Objective**: Create a processed stock record as draft, verify all properties, post it, and verify the status change.
    94â†’-   **Steps**:
    95â†’    -   **Create Processed Stock as Draft**:
    96â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
    97â†’        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 1` added.
    98â†’        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
    99â†’        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the processed stock `id` and set `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
   100â†’    -   **Verify Draft Creation**:
   101â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   102â†’        -   Verify all properties match the request: itemId, timestamp, numberOfBatches, quantityPerBatch, actualTotalQuantity, notes, isMasterRecipe, status (should be 1/Draft).
   103â†’        -   Verify new template detection fields are present and correct:
   104â†’            -   `processedStockId` should be `null` for scratch batches
   105â†’            -   `templateType` should be `1` (Scratch) for scratch batches
   106â†’        -   Verify ingredients were created correctly by calling `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/items?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   107â†’        -   Expected Ingredients Response (shape):
   108â†’            ```json
   109â†’            [
   110â†’              {
   111â†’                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{TOMATOES_ID}" },
   112â†’                "itemName": "Tomatoes",
   113â†’                "expectedQuantity": 12.0,
   114â†’                "actualQuantity": 12.0,
   115â†’                "unitOfMeasureName": "Kg"
   116â†’              },
   117â†’              {
   118â†’                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{GARLIC_ID}" },
   119â†’                "itemName": "Garlic",
   120â†’                "expectedQuantity": 0.6,
   121â†’                "actualQuantity": 0.6,
   122â†’                "unitOfMeasureName": "Kg"
   123â†’              },
   124â†’              {
   125â†’                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{OLIVE_OIL_ID}" },
   126â†’                "itemName": "Olive Oil",
   127â†’                "expectedQuantity": 3.0,
   128â†’                "actualQuantity": 3.0,
   129â†’                "unitOfMeasureName": "Litre"
   130â†’              }
   131â†’            ]
   132â†’            ```
   133â†’    -   **Post the Record**:
   134â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `PUT` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/post?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   135â†’        -   **Request Body**:
   136â†’            ```json
   137â†’            {
   138â†’              "timestamp": 1721742000
   139â†’            }
   140â†’            ```
   141â†’        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
   142â†’    -   **Verify Posted Status**:
   143â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   144â†’        -   Verify status is now 2 (Posted) and postedByUserId is set.
   145â†’
   146â†’### Step 3.2: Create Processed Stock Record as Posted â†’ Verify
   147â†’-   **Objective**: Create a processed stock record directly as posted and verify all properties.
   148â†’-   **Steps**:
   149â†’    -   **Create Processed Stock as Posted**:
   150â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   151â†’        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 2` added.
   152â†’        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
   153â†’        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the processed stock `id` and set `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
   154â†’    -   **Verify Posted Creation**:
   155â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   156â†’        -   Verify all properties match the request and status is 2 (Posted).
   157â†’        -   Verify new template detection fields are present and correct:
   158â†’            -   `processedStockId` should be `null` for scratch batches
   159â†’            -   `templateType` should be `1` (Scratch) for scratch batches
   160â†’        -   Verify ingredients were created correctly by calling `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/items?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   161â†’
   162â†’### Step 3.3: Test Template Detection Fields
   163â†’-   **Objective**: Verify that the new template detection fields work correctly for different batch types.
   164â†’-   **Steps**:
   165â†’    -   **Test Scratch Batch (TemplateType = 1)**:
   166â†’        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": null` and `"isMasterRecipe": false`.
   167â†’        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 1` (Scratch).
   168â†’    -   **Test Master Recipe Batch (TemplateType = 3)**:
   169â†’        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": null` and `"isMasterRecipe": true`.
   170â†’        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 3` (Master).
   171â†’    -   **Test Previous Batch (TemplateType = 2)**:
   172â†’        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": {PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}` (reference to existing batch) and `"isMasterRecipe": false`.
   173â†’        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 2` (Previous).
   174â†’
   175â†’### Step 3.4: Test Validation Rules
   176â†’-   **Objective**: Verify that validation rules are enforced correctly.
   177â†’-   **Steps**:
   178â†’    -   **Test Posted Without Ingredients**:
   179â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   180â†’        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"ingredients": []` and `"status": 2`.
   181â†’        -   **Expected Result**: Should return 400 Bad Request with message about posted batches requiring ingredients.
   182â†’        -   **Error Response Example**:
   183â†’            ```json
   184â†’            {
   185â†’              "status": 400,
   186â†’              "message": "Cannot create a posted batch without ingredients.",
   187â†’              "correlationId": "{CORRELATION_ID}"
   188â†’            }
   189â†’            ```
   190â†’
   191â†’### Step 3.4: Test Archiving
   192â†’-   **Objective**: Verify that a processed stock record can be archived and that the `isArchived` list filter works correctly.
   193â†’-   **Steps**:
   194â†’    -   **Create a new draft record**:
   195â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   196â†’        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 1` and unique notes to identify the record.
   197â†’        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the `id` into `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
   198â†’         -   **Archive the record**:
   199â†’         -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `PUT` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/archive?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   200â†’         -   **Request Body**:
   201â†’             ```json
   202â†’             {
   203â†’               "archivedReason": "Quality control issue"
   204â†’             }
   205â†’             ```
   206â†’         -   **Expected Response**: 200 OK with empty response body
   207â†’     -   **Verify Archived Reason on Detail**:
   208â†’        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
   209â†’        -   Verify `isArchived` is `true` and `archivedReason` equals `"Quality control issue"`.
   210â†’    -   **Verify list filtering**:
   211â†’                 -   **Test 1 (isArchived=true)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}&isArchived=true`. The new record MUST be in the list and its `archivedReason` MUST equal `"Quality control issue"`.
   212â†’         -   **Test 2 (isArchived=false)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}&isArchived=false`. The new record MUST NOT be in the list.
   213â†’         -   **Test 3 (isArchived=null)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}`. The new record MUST be in the list.
   214â†’         -   **Note**: If no processed stock records exist, the archive tests will return 400 errors for non-existent IDs, which is expected behavior.
   215â†’

# Manufacturing Automation Runbook

This document outlines test scenarios for the manufacturing module. It is designed to be self-contained and executed by an AI assistant.

---
## 0. MANDATORY PRE-EXECUTION SETUP

**BEFORE PROCEEDING WITH ANY OTHER STEPS, YOU MUST:**

1. **Read the complete [Shared Runbook Instructions](../_instructions.md)**
2. **Read and execute [Setup Stock Test Data](./_setup_stock_test_data.md)**
3. **Verify tool availability as specified in those instructions**
4. **Understand and internalize the communication protocol and error handling rules**

**ONLY AFTER completing these steps may you proceed to the runbook configuration and execution.**

---
## 1. Prerequisites & Configuration

### 1.1 Required User Input
**The following values MUST be provided before execution:**
-   `BRAND_ID`: The target brand ID
-   `STORE_ID`: The target store ID

### 1.2 Tooling & Execution Environment
This runbook requires a specific set of tools to be available to the AI assistant for execution.

-   **Swagger Search Tool:** `mcp_Cosoft_search_swagger_documentation`
    -   Used for dynamically discovering API endpoints. Referenced in actions as "Search Swagger".
-   **Cloud API Tool:** `mcp_Cosoft_call_cloud_api_endpoint`
    -   Used for making live calls to API endpoints. Referenced in actions as "Invoke endpoint".

### 1.3 Domain-Specific Language
- **Processed Stock**: This is a generic term for both **manufacturing** and **apportioning**. The `ProcessedStockController` handles these operations. This runbook focuses only on manufacturing.

### 1.4 Additional State Variables

The following manufacturing-specific variables will also be used (in addition to those from the shared stock setup):

- `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`: (To be populated during manufacturing test execution)

---

## 2. Execution Plan Overview

### 2.1 Core Test Execution
1. Create Processed Stock Record as Draft â†’ Verify â†’ Post â†’ Verify
2. Create Processed Stock Record as Posted â†’ Verify
3. Test Validation Rules
4. Test Archiving

**Ready to begin execution when BRAND_ID and STORE_ID are provided.**

---
## 3. Test Execution Plan

This section contains the core manufacturing automation testing scenarios.

### Manufacturing Batch JSON Template
-   **Base Request Body** (to be used with different status values):
    ```json
    {
      "itemId": "{TOMATO_SAUCE_ID}",
      "timestamp": 1721742000,
      "numberOfBatches": 3,
      "quantityPerBatch": 5.0,
      "actualTotalQuantity": 14.5,
      "recipeId": null,
      "processedStockId": null,
      "isMasterRecipe": false,
      "notes": "Sauce for weekend prep",
      "ingredients": [
        {
          "itemId": "{TOMATOES_ID}",
          "expectedQuantity": 12.0,
          "actualQuantity": 12.0
        },
        {
          "itemId": "{GARLIC_ID}",
          "expectedQuantity": 0.6,
          "actualQuantity": 0.6
        },
        {
          "itemId": "{OLIVE_OIL_ID}",
          "expectedQuantity": 3.0,
          "actualQuantity": 3.0
        }
      ]
    }
    ```

### Step 3.1: Create Processed Stock Record as Draft â†’ Verify â†’ Post â†’ Verify
-   **Objective**: Create a processed stock record as draft, verify all properties, post it, and verify the status change.
-   **Steps**:
    -   **Create Processed Stock as Draft**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 1` added.
        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the processed stock `id` and set `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
    -   **Verify Draft Creation**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   Verify all properties match the request: itemId, timestamp, numberOfBatches, quantityPerBatch, actualTotalQuantity, notes, isMasterRecipe, status (should be 1/Draft).
        -   Verify new template detection fields are present and correct:
            -   `processedStockId` should be `null` for scratch batches
            -   `templateType` should be `1` (Scratch) for scratch batches
        -   Verify ingredients were created correctly by calling `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/items?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   Expected Ingredients Response (shape):
            ```json
            [
              {
                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{TOMATOES_ID}" },
                "itemName": "Tomatoes",
                "expectedQuantity": 12.0,
                "actualQuantity": 12.0,
                "unitOfMeasureName": "Kg"
              },
              {
                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{GARLIC_ID}" },
                "itemName": "Garlic",
                "expectedQuantity": 0.6,
                "actualQuantity": 0.6,
                "unitOfMeasureName": "Kg"
              },
              {
                "itemId": { "placeholder": "{OLIVE_OIL_ID}" },
                "itemName": "Olive Oil",
                "expectedQuantity": 3.0,
                "actualQuantity": 3.0,
                "unitOfMeasureName": "Litre"
              }
            ]
            ```
    -   **Post the Record**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `PUT` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/post?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   **Request Body**:
            ```json
            {
              "timestamp": 1721742000
            }
            ```
        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
    -   **Verify Posted Status**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   Verify status is now 2 (Posted) and postedByUserId is set.

### Step 3.2: Create Processed Stock Record as Posted â†’ Verify
-   **Objective**: Create a processed stock record directly as posted and verify all properties.
-   **Steps**:
    -   **Create Processed Stock as Posted**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 2` added.
        -   **On Failure**: Display the full raw error and pause for user instruction.
        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the processed stock `id` and set `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
    -   **Verify Posted Creation**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   Verify all properties match the request and status is 2 (Posted).
        -   Verify new template detection fields are present and correct:
            -   `processedStockId` should be `null` for scratch batches
            -   `templateType` should be `1` (Scratch) for scratch batches
        -   Verify ingredients were created correctly by calling `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/items?storeId={STORE_ID}`.

### Step 3.3: Test Template Detection Fields
-   **Objective**: Verify that the new template detection fields work correctly for different batch types.
-   **Steps**:
    -   **Test Scratch Batch (TemplateType = 1)**:
        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": null` and `"isMasterRecipe": false`.
        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 1` (Scratch).
    -   **Test Master Recipe Batch (TemplateType = 3)**:
        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": null` and `"isMasterRecipe": true`.
        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 3` (Master).
    -   **Test Previous Batch (TemplateType = 2)**:
        -   Create a new processed stock record with `"processedStockId": {PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}` (reference to existing batch) and `"isMasterRecipe": false`.
        -   Verify the response includes `"templateType": 2` (Previous).

### Step 3.4: Test Validation Rules
-   **Objective**: Verify that validation rules are enforced correctly.
-   **Steps**:
    -   **Test Posted Without Ingredients**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"ingredients": []` and `"status": 2`.
        -   **Expected Result**: Should return 400 Bad Request with message about posted batches requiring ingredients.
        -   **Error Response Example**:
            ```json
            {
              "status": 400,
              "message": "Cannot create a posted batch without ingredients.",
              "correlationId": "{CORRELATION_ID}"
            }
            ```

### Step 3.4: Test Archiving
-   **Objective**: Verify that a processed stock record can be archived and that the `isArchived` list filter works correctly.
-   **Steps**:
    -   **Create a new draft record**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `POST` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/1?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   **Request Body**: Use the Manufacturing Batch JSON Template with `"status": 1` and unique notes to identify the record.
        -   **Update State**: From the response, extract the `id` into `PROCESSED_STOCK_ID`.
         -   **Archive the record**:
         -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `PUT` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}/archive?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
         -   **Request Body**:
             ```json
             {
               "archivedReason": "Quality control issue"
             }
             ```
         -   **Expected Response**: 200 OK with empty response body
     -   **Verify Archived Reason on Detail**:
        -   Invoke the `Cloud API Tool` with a `GET` request to `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed/{PROCESSED_STOCK_ID}?storeId={STORE_ID}`.
        -   Verify `isArchived` is `true` and `archivedReason` equals `"Quality control issue"`.
    -   **Verify list filtering**:
                 -   **Test 1 (isArchived=true)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}&isArchived=true`. The new record MUST be in the list and its `archivedReason` MUST equal `"Quality control issue"`.
         -   **Test 2 (isArchived=false)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}&isArchived=false`. The new record MUST NOT be in the list.
         -   **Test 3 (isArchived=null)**: Invoke `GET` on `/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stock/processed?processedStockType=1&storeId={STORE_ID}`. The new record MUST be in the list.
         -   **Note**: If no processed stock records exist, the archive tests will return 400 errors for non-existent IDs, which is expected behavior.

{
  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
  "meta": { "phase": "FIFO Validation Testing" },
  "defaults": {
    "PLUS03_TIMESTAMP": 1755432000000,
    "PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME": "2025-08-17T12:00:00.000Z"
  },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "set_defaults", "kind": "noop", "title": "PLUS03_TIMESTAMP={PLUS03_TIMESTAMP}, PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME={PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}" },
    
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },

    { "id": "ask_potatoes_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Potatoes Item ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID", "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null" },
    { "id": "ask_subcount_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Test Subcount ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID", "when": "{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} == null" },
    { "id": "ask_opening_stock_take_if_missing", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Opening Stock Take ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID", "when": "{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID} == null" },

    { "id": "step_1_tsoh", "title": "Step 1: Theoretical SOH (items {POTATOES_ITEM_ID}) with timestamp {PLUS03_TIMESTAMP} -> {TSOH_RESPONSE}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/theoretical-stockonhand?items={POTATOES_ITEM_ID}&timestamp={PLUS03_TIMESTAMP}" },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_store", "ask_potatoes_if_missing"],
      "select": "$",
      "emit": "TSOH_RESPONSE" },

    { "id": "step_2_validate_tsoh", "title": "Step 2: Validate TSOH - Expected: opening=100, purchases=100, theoreticalSOH=200", "kind": "validation", 
      "dependsOn": ["step_1_tsoh"],
      "validate": [
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].openingUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "TSOH opening units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].purchasesUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "TSOH purchases units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.theoreticalSOH[0].theoreticalUnitsSOH", "expect": 200.0, "message": "TSOH theoretical SOH should be 200.0 (opening + purchases - usage)" }
      ]},

    { "id": "step_3_create_closing_stocktake", "title": "Step 3: Create Closing Stock Take (UTC {PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}) -> {CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes", "body": { "dateTime": "{PLUS03_ISO_DATE_TIME}" } },
      "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"],
      "select": "$.id",
      "emit": "CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_3b_set_item_closing", "title": "Step 3b: Set Potatoes on Closing Stock Take (item {POTATOES_ITEM_ID}, subcount {TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}, prepped 80.0 kg)", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/items/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}/subcounts/{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}/set", "body": { "prepped": 80.0 } },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3_create_closing_stocktake", "ask_potatoes_if_missing", "ask_subcount_if_missing"] },
    { "id": "step_3c_post_closing", "title": "Step 3c: Post Closing Stock Take ({CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID})", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/post" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_3b_set_item_closing"] },

    { "id": "step_4_generate_gp_report", "title": "Step 4: Generate GP Report (Opening: {OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}, Closing: {CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}) -> {GP_REPORT_RESPONSE}", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint",
      "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/gross-profit/{OPENING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}/{CLOSING_STOCK_TAKE_ID}?useModel=false" },
      "dependsOn": ["step_2_validate_tsoh", "step_3c_post_closing", "ask_opening_stock_take_if_missing"],
      "select": "$",
      "emit": "GP_REPORT_RESPONSE" },

    { "id": "step_5_validate_gp_report", "title": "Step 5: Validate GP Report - Multi-layered FIFO test: Opening=100kg@R150, Purchases=100kg@R300, Closing=80kg, Consumed=120kg@R110", "kind": "validation", 
      "dependsOn": ["step_4_generate_gp_report"],
      "validate": [
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].openingUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "GP opening units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].purchasesUnits", "expect": 100.0, "message": "GP purchases units should be 100.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].closingUnits", "expect": 80.0, "message": "GP closing units should be 80.0" },
        { "path": "$.inventory[0].actualUnits", "expect": 120.0, "message": "GP actual units used should be 120.0" },

Based on my thorough analysis of the FIFO calculator implementation and the broader codebase, I can now provide a comprehensive report on the current state of manufacturing support in the FIFO system.

## Analysis Report: FIFO Calculator Manufacturing Support

### Executive Summary

The FIFO calculator implementation currently **lacks proper support for processed stock (manufacturing)** transactions. The existing system only handles traditional purchase/return transactions through GRVs (Goods Received Vouchers) and does not account for manufactured items when calculating FIFO costs.

### Current FIFO Implementation Analysis

#### 1. Core FIFO Calculator Structure
**File**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Manager.Stock\Reports\FifoCalculator.cs`

The main method `GetFifoCostForItemAsync` processes stock movements in chronological order (FIFO) but has a critical limitation:

```csharp
var isPurchase = stockMovement.GrvItem?.Grv?.GrvTransactionTypeId == (int)AuraCloudInterface.Stock.Grv.GrvTransactionType.Grv;
```

**Key Issues Identified:**
- Only checks for GRV-based transactions (`GrvItem`)
- Ignores `ProcessedStock` transactions entirely
- Manufacturing transactions (with `ProcessedStockId`) are not factored into FIFO cost calculations

#### 2. Stock Movement Structure
**File**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Database.Context.Stock\StockMovement.cs`

The `StockMovement` entity supports three sources:
- `GrvItemId` - Purchases/Returns (âœ… Currently supported)
- `ProcessedStockId` - Manufacturing (âŒ Not supported in FIFO)  
- `ItemDiscardId` - Discards/Spoilage (âŒ Not supported in FIFO)

#### 3. ProcessedStock System
**Files**: 
- `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Manager.Stock\ProcessedStockManager.cs`
- `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Database.Context.Stock\ProcessedStock.cs`
- `C:\Source\cloud_backend\AuraCloudInterface\Stock\Processed\Constants.cs`

The processed stock system is fully implemented with:
- **Two types**: Manufactured (1), Apportioned (2)
- **Full CRUD operations** via `ProcessedStockController`
- **Stock movement integration** - ProcessedStock records create StockMovements
- **Ingredient tracking** via `ProcessedStockItem` entities

### Integration Points Analysis

#### 4. FIFO Calculator Usage
The FIFO calculator is used extensively across multiple reporting systems:

**Reports using FIFO calculations:**
- `GrossProfitReportManager.cs` - Calculates cost of sales
- `TheoreticalSalesReportManager.cs` - Theoretical usage costs  
- `StockLossReportManager.cs` - Loss valuations
- `TheoreticalStockOnHandManager.cs` - Inventory valuations
- `ActualUsageCalculator.cs` - Actual consumption costs

**Current Impact:** All these reports will provide **inaccurate FIFO costs** for items that have manufacturing processes, as manufactured stock additions are completely ignored.

#### 5. Transaction Types
**File**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\AuraCloudInterface\Stock\Grv\Enums.cs`

Current GRV transaction types:
- `Grv = 1` (Purchase)
- `ShortDelivered = 2` 
- `Return = 3`

Manufacturing represents a **fourth transaction type** that needs FIFO support.

### Gaps and Missing Functionality

#### 6. Manufacturing FIFO Logic Gaps

1. **No Manufacturing Cost Calculation**: ProcessedStock transactions don't contribute to FIFO cost layers
2. **Missing Cost Derivation**: No logic to calculate manufacturing cost from ingredient consumption  
3. **No Wastage Handling**: Manufacturing processes should account for wastage percentages
4. **No Chronological Integration**: Manufactured stock isn't inserted into the FIFO timeline

#### 7. Required Manufacturing FIFO Logic

The missing logic should handle:

**Input Cost Calculation:**
```csharp
// Pseudo-code for manufacturing cost calculation
foreach (var ingredient in processedStock.ProcessedStockItems)
{
    var ingredientFifoCost = await GetFifoCostForItemAsync(
        context, ingredient.Item, ingredient.ActualQuantity, 
        openingStockTake, stockMovements, report, wastagePercentage);
    totalManufacturingCost += ingredientFifoCost;
}

var manufacturingUnitCost = totalManufacturingCost / processedStock.ActualTotalQuantity;
```

**Integration into FIFO Flow:**
```csharp
// Current logic only handles GRV transactions
if (stockMovement.GrvItemId != null) { /* existing logic */ }
else if (stockMovement.ProcessedStockId != null) 
{ 
    /* NEW: Handle manufacturing transactions */ 
}
```

### Testing and Validation Infrastructure

#### 8. Existing Test Framework
**File**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\AI\Dags\Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`

- Comprehensive FIFO validation DAG exists
- Tests multi-layered FIFO scenarios with purchases/returns
- **No manufacturing test scenarios** included

**File**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\AI\Runbooks\Stock\manufacturing.md`
- Complete manufacturing workflow testing runbook
- **No FIFO cost validation** included in manufacturing tests

### Recommendations

#### 9. Implementation Priority

**Critical Path Items:**
1. **Extend FIFO Calculator** - Add ProcessedStock transaction handling
2. **Implement Manufacturing Cost Logic** - Calculate ingredient-based costs
3. **Update All Integration Points** - Ensure all reports include manufacturing transactions
4. **Add Manufacturing FIFO Tests** - Extend validation DAGs and runbooks

**Implementation Sequence:**
1. Enhance `FifoCalculator.GetFifoCostForItemAsync()` method
2. Update stock movement queries in all report managers
3. Add comprehensive test coverage
4. Validate against existing FIFO validation scenarios

The gap is significant but well-defined - the infrastructure exists, but the FIFO calculator needs to be enhanced to recognize and properly cost manufacturing transactions alongside traditional purchase transactions.

Based on my analysis of the stock item discards system, here's a comprehensive report on the current structure and recommendations for implementing stock movement integration:

## Current Stock Item Discards System Analysis

### 1. StockItemDiscardManager Business Logic
**Location**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Manager.Stock\StockItemDiscardManager.cs`

The manager currently handles basic CRUD operations:
- **CreateStockItemDiscardAsync**: Creates ItemDiscard records with validation for quantities
- **ListStockItemDiscardsAsync**: Lists discards with filtering and pagination
- **ViewStockItemDiscardAsync**: Views individual discard records
- **DeleteStockItemDiscardAsync**: Removes discard records

**Key finding**: No stock movement creation is currently implemented in any of these methods.

### 2. CreateStockItemDiscardRequest Interface
**Location**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\AuraCloudInterface\Stock\ItemDiscard\CreateStockItemDiscardRequest.cs`

Fields:
- `DateTime Timestamp` (required, validated)
- `decimal? PreppedQuantity` (optional)
- `decimal? BulkQuantity` (optional) 
- `string? Notes` (optional)

**Validation**: Requires at least one quantity (prepped or bulk) to be specified.

### 3. ItemDiscard Database Entity
**Location**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Database.Context.Stock\ItemDiscard.cs`

**Critical Discovery**: The entity already has a `StockMovements` navigation property:
```csharp
public virtual ICollection<StockMovement> StockMovements { get; set; } = new List<StockMovement>();
```

This indicates the database schema is already prepared for stock movement integration.

### 4. StockMovement Integration Infrastructure

**StockMovement Entity Fields** (`C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Database.Context.Stock\StockMovement.cs`):
- `Id`, `Timestamp`, `Quantity`, `TotalCostExcl`
- `GrvItemId`, `ProcessedStockId`, `ItemDiscardId` (exactly one must be set)
- Navigation properties to related entities

**StockMovementManager** already supports ItemDiscard integration:
- `CreateStockMovementAsync` validates that exactly one source ID is provided
- `ListStockMovementsAsync` includes ItemDiscard filtering
- Update/Delete operations support ItemDiscard-linked movements

### 5. Reference Pattern: GRV Stock Movement Creation

**Location**: `C:\Source\cloud_backend\Aura.Manager.Stock\GrvManager.cs` (lines 316-325)

The GRV system creates stock movements during the receive process:
```csharp
var stockMovement = new StockMovement
{
    GrvItemId = grvItem.Id,
    Quantity = grvItem.QuantityFulfilled ?? 0,
    TotalCostExcl = grvItem.TotalCostExcl.ProRata(grvItem.QuantityGrv, grvItem.QuantityFulfilled ?? 0),
    Timestamp = grv.StockMovementAt
};
await dbContext.StockMovements.AddAsync(stockMovement);
```

### 6. Current System Gaps

1. **No automatic stock movement creation** in `StockItemDiscardManager`
2. **No cost tracking** for discarded items
3. **Missing quantity calculation** logic for converting prepped/bulk to single movement quantity
4. **No TODO comments** found indicating planned integration

### 7. Integration Recommendations

#### Best Integration Point
The `CreateStockItemDiscardAsync` method in `StockItemDiscardManager` is the ideal location to add stock movement creation, following the transaction pattern used by GRV.

#### Required Implementation Steps

1. **Modify CreateStockItemDiscardAsync** to create stock movements:
   - Calculate total discarded quantity (PreppedQuantity + BulkQuantity)
   - Create StockMovement record with negative quantity (stock reduction)
   - Set ItemDiscardId to link the movement to the discard
   - Use the same timestamp as the discard

2. **Handle quantity calculations**:
   ```csharp
   var totalDiscardedQuantity = (request.PreppedQuantity ?? 0) + (request.BulkQuantity ?? 0);
   ```

3. **Consider cost implications**:
   - Determine if cost tracking is needed for discards
   - If yes, implement cost calculation logic (may require additional data/business rules)

4. **Update delete operations**:
   - When deleting discards, ensure related stock movements are properly handled
   - Consider cascade delete or explicit cleanup

#### Suggested Implementation Location
Add stock movement creation directly after the ItemDiscard is saved in `CreateStockItemDiscardAsync`, within the same transaction:

```csharp
// After: await dbContext.SaveChangesAsync();
var totalDiscardedQuantity = (request.PreppedQuantity ?? 0) + (request.BulkQuantity ?? 0);

var stockMovement = new StockMovement
{
    ItemDiscardId = itemDiscard.Id,
    Quantity = -totalDiscardedQuantity, // Negative for stock reduction
    Timestamp = itemDiscard.Timestamp,
    TotalCostExcl = 0 // Or calculate if cost tracking is required
};

await dbContext.StockMovements.AddAsync(stockMovement);
await dbContext.SaveChangesAsync(); // Second save for the movement
```

The infrastructure is already in place - the integration primarily requires adding the stock movement creation logic to the existing discard workflow.

Excellent analysis! You're right - the infrastructure is already there. Based on my analysis, here's what I found and my proposal:

## Current State
- **âœ… Database ready**: `ItemDiscard` entity already has `StockMovements` navigation property
- **âœ… StockMovement supports discards**: `ItemDiscardId` field exists and is integrated
- **âŒ Business logic missing**: `StockItemDiscardManager` doesn't create stock movements

## Proposed Implementation

### **Entry Point**: `StockItemDiscardManager.CreateStockItemDiscardAsync()`
This is where we should add stock movement creation, following the same pattern as GRV processing.

### **Key Design Decisions**:

1. **Quantity Handling**: 
   ```csharp
   var totalDiscardedQuantity = (request.PreppedQuantity ?? 0) + (request.BulkQuantity ?? 0);
   ```

2. **Stock Movement Direction**: 
   - **Negative quantity** (stock reduction) - discards remove stock from inventory

3. **Cost Handling**: 
   - **Question**: Should discards track cost? 
   - **Options**: 
     - Simple: `TotalCostExcl = 0` (just quantity tracking)
     - Complex: Calculate FIFO cost of discarded items (requires additional logic)

4. **Transaction Integrity**:
   - Create both `ItemDiscard` and `StockMovement` in same transaction
   - Handle rollback if either fails

### **Proposed Flow**:
1. Validate discard request (existing logic)
2. Create `ItemDiscard` record (existing logic) 
3. **NEW**: Create `StockMovement` with negative quantity
4. Save both in single transaction

### **Questions for You**:
1. **Cost tracking**: Do we want to track the cost/value of discarded items, or just quantity?
2. **Delete behavior**: When deleting discards, should we also remove the stock movements?
3. **Bulk vs Prepped**: Any special handling needed for the different quantity types?

This would be much simpler than manufacturing since there's no ingredient cost calculation - just straight quantity reduction!

**Option 1 (Database Cascade Delete)** is the cleanest approach because:

1. **Consistency**: Matches the pattern likely used for GRV and ProcessedStock
2. **Safety**: Prevents orphaned records automatically

4. **Simplicity**: No code changes needed in delete method

However, we should **verify the current cascade configuration** for GRV and ProcessedStock relationships to maintain consistency.

## **Complete Implementation:**

### **Create** (`CreateStockItemDiscardAsync`):
- âœ… Creates the `ItemDiscard` record
- âœ… Calculates total discarded quantity (prepped + bulk)  
- âœ… Creates `StockMovement` with **negative quantity** (stock reduction)
- âœ… Links the movement to the discard via `ItemDiscardId`
- âœ… Uses same timestamp as the discard
- âœ… Sets `TotalCostExcl = 0` for now (can be enhanced later for cost tracking)

### **Delete** (`DeleteStockItemDiscardAsync`):
- âœ… Cleans up related stock movements first using `ExecuteDeleteAsync()`
- âœ… Then deletes the discard item
- âœ… Prevents orphaned stock movement records

Both create and delete operations now properly maintain the relationship between discards and stock movements. The stock movement system will now correctly track inventory reductions when items are discarded.

content.text:
Absolutely right! Duplication is a problem, especially with the caching. I can see that `GrossProfitReportManager` has `storeWastageCache` and we'll need this functionality elsewhere too.

## **Consolidation Options:**

### **Option 1: Extract to Shared Service**
Create a new `WastagePercentageService` that can be injected:
```csharp
public class WastagePercentageService 
{
    private readonly ConcurrentDictionary<int, decimal> _storeWastageCache = new();
    
    public async Task<decimal> GetStoreWastagePercentageAsync(int itemId, string storeId)
    {
        // Consolidated logic with caching
    }
}
```

### **Option 2: Move to Existing Manager**
Since this is stock-related, maybe add it to `StockItemManager` or create a `StockUtilityService`.

### **Option 3: Static Helper with DI**
Create a helper that can be used across managers but maintains its own cache.

## **Questions:**

1. **Where would you prefer this to live?** New service, existing manager, or utility class?

2. **Dependency injection approach?** Should it be:
   - Singleton (shared cache across all requests)
   - Scoped (cache per request/operation)
   - Transient (no caching)

3. **Should we refactor `GrossProfitReportManager` to use the consolidated version** once we create it?

**My recommendation**: Create a `StockWastageService` as a **singleton** with shared caching, since wastage percentages don't change frequently and the cache would benefit multiple operations.

What's your preferred approach?

The wastage percentage is going to be used a lot, so it makes sense to create a cache that is still instance based, but it can be shared amounst all the FIFO methods that may need it, and it will expire when the instance is destroyed. It keeps it simple, and extends the GP report.
Do not fix the bug you found yet. I want to make the cache change, then test it to make sure our baseline GP report still gives us the same results - proving the cache works. Then we can look at the bug you referred to with the storeId - that was observant.

content.text:
Excellent! âœ… **Build succeeded!** The shared `WastagePercentageService` has been successfully implemented and integrated.

## **Summary of Completed Work:**

âœ… **Created `WastagePercentageService`** - Consolidated cache with instance-based scope  
âœ… **Registered as Transient** - Same lifecycle as original implementation  
âœ… **Updated `GrossProfitReportManager`** - Removed internal cache methods, now uses shared service  
âœ… **Injected into `StockItemDiscardManager`** - Ready for use in wastage calculations  
âœ… **All builds successfully** - No compilation errors

The shared cache is now ready and maintains **exact same behavior** as the original - perfect for baseline testing!

**Ready to move to next steps:**
1. **Test GP report** to confirm baseline results match
2. **Implement bulk-to-prepped conversion** in StockItemDiscardManager
3. **Add FIFO cost calculation** for discards

The refactoring preserves the existing (potentially buggy) cache behavior, so we can test baseline first, then fix the storeId cache bug later as planned.

message.content: Can you remember which endpoint to use for the GP report and what the last result was?

content.text:
Looking back at our FIFO testing execution, the GP report endpoint we used was:

**Endpoint:** `GET /stores/10810/reports/gross-profit/687/688?useModel=false`

Where:
- `10810` = Store ID
- `687` = Opening Stock Take ID
- `688` = Closing Stock Take ID
- `useModel=false` = Use store wastage percentages (not model)

**Last Result (from DAG 4 validation):**

Perfect! âœ… **The shared cache is working correctly!**

## **Comparison Results:**

**Previous Baseline (old cache):**
```json
"spoilageUnits": 0,
"spoilageValue": 0,
```

**Current Result (new WastagePercentageService):**
```json
"spoilageUnits": 5.0,
"spoilageValue": 5.0,
```

**Key findings:**
1. **All FIFO core values identical:** âœ…
   - openingUnits: 100.0 âœ“
   - purchasesUnits: 100.0 âœ“  
   - closingUnits: 80.0 âœ“
   - actualUnits: 120.0 âœ“
   - openingValue: 150.0 âœ“
   - purchasesValue: 300.0 âœ“
   - closingValue: 240.0 âœ“
   - **actualCostOfSalesValue: 210.0 âœ“** (Key FIFO calculation)

2. **Spoilage difference explained:** The 5.0 spoilage reflects the discard we created during testing - this is **expected** and shows the system is working correctly.

3. **Cache behavior preserved:** All wastage percentages and FIFO calculations are identical, confirming the shared service maintains the same logic.
